channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Google Cloud chief reveals the long game: a decade of silicon and the energy battle behind the AI boom
item.description: "We've worked on TPUs since 2014 ... a long time before AI was fashionable," Thomas Kurian said at the Fortune Brainstorm AI conference.

item.title: A huge chunk of U.S. GDP growth is being kept alive by AI spending ‘with no guaranteed return,’ Deutsche Bank says
item.description: “Investment in AI-related sectors is critical to GDP growth [and the] US would be close to recession this year if it weren’t for tech-related spending...

item.title: OpenAI’s CEO Sam Altman says in 10 years’ time college graduates will be working ‘some completely new, exciting, super well-paid’ job in space
item.description: While Bill Gates has said the two-day workweek could come within the next decade, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says Gen Alpha college graduates will be too b...

item.title: Why restricting graduate loans will bankrupt America’s talent supply chain
item.description: The K-shaped divide is no longer confined to the labor market. It’s now embedded in its foundation: education.

item.title: 6 ‘unhinged’ things Spanx founder Sara Blakely did that ultimately shaped the success of her $1.2 billion empire
item.description: Blakely became the first self-made female billionaire in 2012.

item.title: This big-name strategist thinks gold can hit $6,000 in 2026 and $10,000 by 2030
